alert.note: Alert for Elbert; Lincoln (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 16 at 5:33PM MDT until June 16 at 7:15PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR CENTRAL ELBERT AND CENTRAL LINCOLN COUNTIES... At 533 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated showers and thunderstorms producing moderate to heavy rain continue across the warned area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have already fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.25 to 1 inch in 1 hour or less. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing. Local officials indicated flooding ongoing in the streets of Limon along with flooding along Highway 71 south of Limon and Highway 24. No reports of flooding have been received in Elbert county. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, gulches, roads, and poor drainage and low-lying areas. These include Big Sandy Creek, East Bijou Creek, and Long Branch Creek. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Limon, Elbert, Hugo, Simla, Genoa, Matheson and Fondis. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.25-1 INCH IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life.
